brokkr¶

Tensors¶

Define stress/strain tensors.

class brokkr.Tensor(matrix)¶

Bases: unyt.array.unyt_array

Base 3x3 symmetric tensor.

Parameters:
  • matrix (numpy.array_like) – an array-like object with six values
  • units (string or unyt.Units) – the physical units for the tensor

Check if dimensions of vector match dim.

Parameters:dim (unyt.dimensions dimension) – the dimension to compare the instance against
Returns:True if instance’s dimension matches dim; False otherwise.
Return type:bool
set_v_item(vindex, new_val)¶

Set an item in-place using Voigt index.

Parameters:
  • vindex (int) – the Voigt index of the item to set
  • new_val (float) – the new value for the specified vindex
voigt¶

The Voigt representation of the array.

class brokkr.Stress(matrix)¶

Bases: brokkr._tensor.Tensor

Stress tensor.

A subset of the tensor class, the stress tensor requires that units be in pressure and provides additional, stress-specific functionality.

principal¶

Array of principal stresses.

The array format is:

\[\begin{split}\left[ \begin{matrix} (\sigma_{xy})_1 & (\sigma_{xy})_2 & (\tau_{xy})_\text{max} \\ (\sigma_{yz})_1 & (\sigma_{yz})_2 & (\tau_{yz})_\text{max} \\ (\sigma_{zx})_1 & (\sigma_{zx})_2 & (\tau_{zx})_\text{max} \end{matrix} \right]\end{split}\]
vonMises()¶

The equivalent von Mises stress of the stress tensor.

The von Mises stress \(\sigma_{v}\) is defined:

\[\sigma_{v} = \sqrt{ \frac{1}{2} \left[ \left( \sigma_{11} - \sigma_{22} \right) ^ 2 + \left( \sigma_{22} - \sigma_{33} \right) ^ 2 + \left( \sigma_{33} - \sigma_{11} \right) ^ 2 + 6 \left( \tau_{12}^2 + \tau_{23}^2 + \tau_{31}^2 \right) \right] }\]
class brokkr.Strain(matrix)¶

Bases: brokkr._tensor.Tensor

Strain tensor.

A subset of the tensor class, the strain tensor requires that units be in units of length/length and provides additional, strain-specific functionality.

Parameters:stype ({'engineering', 'tensor'}) – the type of shear strain
stype¶

Strain type.

Must be ‘engineering’ or ‘tensor’ strain.

Notes

Only affects shear strains (i.e. \(\varepsilon_4\), \(\varepsilon_5\), and \(\varepsilon_6\)). Using Voigt notation, the relationship is defined:

\[\begin{split}\underbrace{ \left[ \begin{matrix} \varepsilon_1 \\ \varepsilon_2 \\ \varepsilon_3 \\ \varepsilon_4 \\ \varepsilon_5 \\ \varepsilon_6 \end{matrix} \right] }_\text{contracted notation} = \underbrace{ \left[ \begin{matrix} \varepsilon_{11} \\ \varepsilon_{22} \\ \varepsilon_{33} \\ \gamma_{23} \\ \gamma_{31} \\ \gamma_{12} \end{matrix} \right] }_\text{engineering strain} = \underbrace{ \left[ \begin{matrix} \varepsilon_{11} \\ \varepsilon_{22} \\ \varepsilon_{33} \\ 2 \varepsilon_{23} \\ 2 \varepsilon_{31} \\ 2 \varepsilon_{12} \end{matrix} \right] }_\text{engineering strain}\end{split}\]

Vectors¶

Define vector classes.

class brokkr._vector.Vector¶

Bases: unyt.array.unyt_array

Base 3x1 vector array.

Parameters:
  • matrix (numpy.array_like) – an array-like object with three items
  • units (string or unyt.Unit object) – the physical units for the vector

Notes

If units is supplied as a string, it must conform to the same formatting rules as the unyt.array.unyt_array.to() method.

Returns:True if instance’s dimension matches dim; False otherwise.
Return type:bool

The resultant magnitude.

Functions¶

Miscellaneous functions used in brokkr.

brokkr.bmath.ms(applied, allowed, knockdown=1)¶

Calculate the margin of safety.

The margin of safety is calculated according to the following formula:

\[MS = \frac{F_{\text{app}}}{k F_{alw}} - 1\]

where

\(MS\) margin of safety
\(F_{\text{app}}\) applied load
\(F_{\text{alw}}\) allowable

Note

The applied and allowed values must have the same units.

Parameters:
  • applied (float) – applied stress, load, or strain
  • allowed (float) – the allowable strength
  • knockdown (float) – allowable knockdown factor (default=1)
Returns:

the margin of safety
Return type:

float

Notes

It is also possible to calculate a margin of safety using a failure index by substituting the failure index in for the applied value and setting the allowed value to 1

brokkr.bmath.matrix_minor(matrix, indices)¶

Return the minor of a 2D numpy.ndarray.

Parameters:
  • matrix (2D numpy.ndarray) – the matrix from which to find a minor
  • indices (tuple of ints) – a tuple of two values indicating the row and columns for the minor
Returns:

the matrix minor
Return type:

numpy.ndarray
Raises:

ValueError – If the supplied indices is not a tuple of two integers or if matrix is not square
